verses.text: 耶穌又用比喻對他們說：「有一個人栽種了一個葡萄園，四面圍上籬笆，挖了一個壓酒池，蓋了一座瞭望臺，然後租給佃戶，就遠行去了。

words.note: Lit. 'pressing-wine pool'

words.definition: travel far, go on a journey

verses.text: 到了時候，園主派了一個僕人到佃戶那裡，向佃戶收取葡萄園一部分的果子。
佃戶抓住他，打了他，放他空手回去。
園主再派另外一個僕人到他們那裡，他們打傷了他的頭，並且侮辱他。
園主又派另一個去，他們就把他殺了。後來又派去許多僕人，有的給他們打了，有的給他們殺了。
還有一個，就是園主的愛子，最後園主派他到那裡去，說：『他們必尊敬我的兒子。』

words.note: Specifically refers to the owner of a vineyard in parables.
Often refers to Jesus as God's beloved son in a biblical context.

verses.text: 那些佃戶卻彼此說：『這是繼承產業的；來，我們殺了他，產業就是我們的了。』

words.note: Refers to tenant farmers, common in biblical agricultural contexts.
Indicates a change of state or new situation.

verses.text: 於是抓住他，把他殺了，扔在葡萄園外。

words.note: Resultative complement indicating firm action.
Introduces the object of a verb before the verb.
A common setting for parables in the Bible.

verses.text: 這樣，葡萄園的主人要怎麼辦呢？他要來除掉那些佃戶，把葡萄園租給別人。
你們沒有念過這段聖經嗎：『建築工人所棄的石頭，成了房角的主要石頭；

words.note: Lit. 'holy scripture'.
Indicates the agent or object of an action, often forming a nominal phrase.
More formal or literary than '丟掉'.
Often used in the biblical idiom '房角石' (cornerstone).

verses.text: 這是主所作的，在我們眼中看為希奇。』」

words.note: Refers to God or Christ in a religious context.
Forms a noun phrase with the following verb, indicating 'that which is done'.
Marks a possessive or descriptive relationship.
Lit. 'eye-middle', meaning 'in one's eyes/sight'.
Often used in biblical contexts to describe God's marvelous works.

verses.text: 他們知道他這比喻是針對他們說的，就想要捉拿他，但因為害怕群眾，只好離開他走了。

words.note: A common term for parables in the Bible.

words.definition: to be aimed at, to target

words.note: Indicates a descriptive or attributive relationship.

words.definition: to want, to be going to

verses.text: 後來，他們派了幾個法利賽人和希律黨的人到耶穌那裡去，要找他的把柄來陷害他。

words.note: General measure word for people or things.

words.definition: to want, to be going to

words.note: Indicates purpose or direction 'in order to'.

verses.heading: Paying Taxes to Caesar

verses.text: 他們來到了，就對他說：「老師，我們知道你為人誠實，不顧忌任何人，因為你不徇情面，只照著真理把 神的道教導人。請問納稅給凱撒可以不可以？我們該納不該納呢？」

words.definition: to conduct oneself, to be a person
to show partiality, to be swayed by personal feelings

words.note: Lit. 'following/shining upon'.
A core concept in Christianity.
Marks the object of a verb, placing it before the verb.
In biblical contexts, refers to God's word/message or the 'Way'.
Short for 納稅.
Short for 納稅.
Used at the end of a question to soften it or ask for a suggestion.

verses.text: 耶穌看出他們的假意，就對他們說：「你們為甚麼試探我呢？拿一個銀幣來給我，讓我看看。」

words.note: Compound verb indicating 'to see and perceive the truth'.
Often used in biblical contexts referring to spiritual testing or temptation.
Used after a verb to indicate direction towards the speaker.
Reduplication of verb to indicate a brief or casual action.

verses.text: 他們就拿來了。耶穌問他們：「這是誰的像，誰的名號？」他們回答他：「凱撒的。」

words.note: Refers to the name or title inscribed on a coin.
Implies 'Caesar's [image/inscription/belongings]'.

verses.text: 耶穌說：「凱撒的應當歸給凱撒， 神的應當歸給 神。」他們就對他十分驚奇。

words.note: Capitalized contextually as God.
Capitalized contextually as God.

verses.text: 撒都該人向來認為沒有復活的事，他們來到耶穌那裡，問他：
verses.heading: Marriage and the Resurrection

verses.text: 「老師，摩西曾寫給我們說：『如果一個人死了，留下妻子，沒有兒女，他的弟弟就應當娶他的妻子，為哥哥立後。』

words.note: Refers to establishing an heir for a deceased brother, as per Mosaic Law.

verses.text: 從前有兄弟七人，頭一個娶了妻子，死了，沒有留下孩子；

words.note: Used as a measure word for people.

verses.text: 第二個娶了她，也沒有留下孩子，就死了；第三個也是這樣。

words.definition: did not have, there was no

verses.text: 那七個人都沒有留下孩子，最後那女人也死了。

words.definition: did not have, there was no

verses.text: 到了復活的時候，他們都要復活，她是哪一個的妻子呢？因為七個人都娶過她。」

words.note: Indicates the attainment of a state or moment.
Commonly refers to resurrection from the dead in religious contexts.
Commonly refers to resurrection from the dead in religious contexts.
Indicates a past experience.

verses.text: 耶穌對他們說：「你們錯了，不正是因為你們不明白聖經，也不曉得 神的能力嗎？

words.note: Refers specifically to the Bible.
A more literary or polite way to say 'know' than 知道 (zhīdào).
Refers to the singular, divine God in the Christian context. Often capitalized as 'God'.

verses.text: 因為人從死裡復活以後，也不娶，也不嫁，而是像天上的天使一樣。

words.note: Often used in the phrase '從死裡復活' (to rise from the dead).
Commonly refers to resurrection from the dead in religious contexts.
In a biblical context, often refers to the spiritual heaven.
Lit. 'heavenly messenger'.

verses.text: 關於死人復活的事，摩西的經卷中荊棘篇上， 神怎樣對他說：『我是亞伯拉罕的 神，以撒的 神，雅各的 神』，你們沒有念過嗎？

words.note: Refers to coming back to life after death.
Refers to the burning bush in Exodus.
Measure word for articles, chapters, or sections of text.
Often used as a postpositional particle indicating 'on' or 'in'.
The leading space is a reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.
The leading space is a reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.
The leading space is a reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.
The leading space is a reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 他不是死人的 神，而是活人的 神。你們是大錯特錯了！」

words.note: The leading space is a reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.
The leading space is a reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.
An idiom meaning 'completely wrong' or 'making a huge mistake'.
Indicates a change of state or completion of an action.

verses.text: 有一個經學家，聽到他們的辯論，覺得耶穌回答得好，就來問他：「誡命中哪一條是第一重要的呢？」

words.note: An expert in religious classics or law.
Used after a verb or adjective to indicate degree or result.
條 (tiáo) is a measure word for long, thin objects, and also for rules or items.
Used to ask for elaboration or a soft question.

verses.heading: The Greatest Commandment

verses.text: 耶穌回答：「第一重要的是：『以色列啊，你要聽！主我們的 神是獨一的主。

words.note: Expresses exclamation, often used with vocatives.
Indicates necessity, desire, or intention.
The leading space is a reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.
Often used in religious contexts to mean 'the one and only'.

verses.text: 你要全心、全性、全意、全力，愛主你的 神。』

words.note: Indicates necessity, desire, or intention.
Emphasizes complete sincerity and devotion.
Refers to one's entire inner being or life force.
Implies complete understanding and thought.
With all one's physical and mental effort.
The leading space is a reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 其次是：『要愛人如己。』再沒有別的誡命比這兩條更重要的了。」
那經學家對耶穌說：「老師，是的，你說的很對， 神是獨一的，除了他以外再沒有別的 神。

words.note: Expert in the Jewish law and scriptures.
Refers to other deities, not the singular God.

verses.text: 我們要用全心、全意、全力去愛他，並且要愛人如己，這就比一切燔祭和各樣祭物好得多了。」

words.note: Indicates the purpose or direction of an action.
Fixed phrase indicating a significant degree of improvement.

verses.text: 耶穌見他回答得有智慧，就對他說：「你距離 神的國不遠了。」從此再也沒有人敢問他了。

words.note: Here implies 'when Jesus saw/realized'.
Implies God's kingdom in this context.

verses.text: 耶穌在殿裡教訓人，說：「經學家怎麼說基督是大衛的子孫呢？
verses.heading: The Messiah: David’s Son and Lord

verses.text: 大衛自己被聖靈感動卻說：『主對我的主說：你坐在我的右邊，等我把你的仇敵放在你的腳下（有些抄本作「等我使你的仇敵作你的腳凳」）。』

words.note: Refers to God or Christ in a religious context.
Here referring to the Messiah, distinguished from the divine 'Lord' (Zhǔ).
Used to bring the object before the verb.

verses.text: 大衛自己既然稱他為主，他又怎麼會是大衛的子孫呢？」群眾都喜歡聽他。

words.note: Here referring to the Messiah, distinguished from the divine 'Lord' (Zhǔ).

verses.text: 耶穌教導人的時候，說：「你們要提防經學家，他們喜歡穿長袍走來走去，喜歡人在市中心向他們問安，
verses.heading: Warnings About Experts in the Law

verses.text: 又喜歡會堂裡的高位，筵席上的首座。
他們吞沒了寡婦的房產，又假裝作冗長的禱告。這些人必受更重的刑罰。」

words.note: Indicates completed action or change of state.

verses.text: 耶穌面對銀庫坐著，看著大家怎樣把錢投入庫中。許多有錢的人投入很多的錢。

words.note: Literally 'silver treasury'.
'中' here functions as a locative suffix, meaning 'inside'.

verses.heading: The Widow’s Offering

verses.text: 後來，有一個窮寡婦來投入了兩個小錢，就是一個銅錢。

words.note: '了' marks the completion of the action.
Refers to the lowest denomination coins in the Roman monetary system, 'lepta'.
Used to introduce an explanation or clarification.
A type of small coin, often made of copper or bronze.

verses.text: 耶穌把門徒叫過來，對他們說：「我實在告訴你們，這窮寡婦投入庫裡的，比眾人投的更多。

words.note: '過來' indicates motion towards the speaker.
Emphasizes sincerity or truth of a statement.
'裡' indicates 'inside'.
Refers to a crowd or multitude of people.

verses.text: 因為他們都是把自己剩餘的投入，這寡婦是自己不足，卻把她一切所有的，就是全部養生的，都投進去了。」

words.note: What remains after some part is taken or used.
Means 'not enough' or 'lacking'.
Literally 'that which one has'.
Originally a verb-object compound meaning 'to nourish life', here functions as noun for 'livelihood'.
'進去' indicates motion inward; '了' marks completion.
